summary: Defines a comprehensive collection of Pydantic and dataclass schemas used throughout the LiteLLM proxy for handling configuration, authentication, user/team/organization management, budget control, request/response validation, and auxiliary utilities such as Slack alert payloads and token hashing.
business_intent: Enable the LiteLLM proxy to reliably validate, serialize, and process data related to API keys, users, teams, organizations, budgets, and system settings, supporting secure authentication, roleâ€‘based access, and operational monitoring.
